message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Disagree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I were a Norwegian primary or secondary school teacher. I need to provide responses to each of the 10 statements about AI.

Let me think about each statement from the perspective of a thoughtful educator:

TT4G35A: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is generally true. AI tools can assist with lesson planning. I'd say "Agree" to this.

TT4G35B: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is a capability AI has, though it depends on implementation. I'd say "Agree" to this.

TT4G35C: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - AI can provide personalized learning paths and feedback. I'd say "Agree" to this.

TT4G35D: AI supports students with specific needs (multilingual, special education) - AI can help with translations, text-to-speech, adaptive materials. I'd say "Agree" to this.

TT4G35E: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is definitely true. AI can help with grading, attendance, scheduling, etc. I'd say "Strongly agree" to this.

TT4G35F: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a real concern with AI. Students could use AI-generated content and pass it off as their own. I'd say "Agree" to this negative aspect.

TT4G35G: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - AI can make errors and inappropriate suggestions. This is a valid concern. I'd say "Agree" to this.

TT4G35H: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a documented concern with AI systems. I'd say "Agree" to this.

TT4G35I: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a significant concern. AI systems often require data collection. I'd say "Agree" to this.
 
TT4G35J: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students - While this could happen, most educational AI is built with sound pedagogical principles in mind. I'd lean toward "Disagree" on this one, though implementation varies.

Now I'll structure these responses for the function call.
